Monitors battery voltage and provides: overcharge protection (4.3V cutoff), overdischarge protection (2.4V cutoff), overcurrent protection (3A), and short circuit protection. Works with FS8205A dual N-FET as series disconnect switch. Place between battery connector and TP4056/system. This is the same protection circuit found inside every commercial LiPo pack — adding it on-board protects bare cells. 3µA quiescent current. Auto-add with LiPo power.
safety_warnings: Battery protection IC for single-cell LiPo — NOT suitable for multi-cell packs
Does not replace proper battery pack safety certification for commercial products
Overdischarge cutoff (2.4V) may be too low for some cells — check cell datasheet

control.name: OD
control.note: Overdischarge MOSFET gate drive — to FS8205A G1

control.name: CS
control.note: Current sense input — voltage across FS8205A Rdson

control.name: OC
control.note: Overcharge MOSFET gate drive — to FS8205A G2

control.name: TD
control.note: Time delay — add cap for adjustable delay, or leave NC

pins.notes: Works with FS8205A dual N-FET. VCC to battery positive, GND to system ground via FETs.

dw01a.substitution_notes: Specific part required — do not substitute.

fs8205a.ipc610_notes: TSSOP-8. Dual N-channel MOSFET pair for battery protection. Back-to-back configuration: one FET for discharge protection, one for charge protection. Controlled by DW01A IC. Very low Rds(on) (25mΩ typical) — minimal voltage drop. 6A continuous rating handles all Eisla designs. Place in series between battery negative terminal and system GND. Auto-add with DW01A.

terminals.name: S1
terminals.note: Source FET1 — connect to battery negative

terminals.name: G1
terminals.note: Gate FET1 — overdischarge control from DW01A OD (pin 1)

terminals.name: D2
terminals.note: Drain FET2 — internally connected to D1

terminals.name: D1
terminals.note: Drain FET1 — internally connected to D2 (common drain)

terminals.name: G2
terminals.note: Gate FET2 — overcharge control from DW01A OC (pin 3)

terminals.name: S2
terminals.note: Source FET2 — connect to system GND

pins.notes: Dual N-FET. Back-to-back configuration: S1 to battery negative, S2 to system GND. D1/D2 internally connected (common drain). DW01A controls gates.

fs8205a.substitution_notes: Specific part required — do not substitute.

res_10k_ntc_disable.ipc610_notes: 0402 10k 1%. TP4056 TEMP pin resistor. Two usage modes: (A) If battery has NTC thermistor — place footprint for NTC connector, populate this as fallback. (B) If no NTC — connect TEMP pin to GND via 10k to simulate 25°C, allowing charging to proceed. TP4056 TEMP pin expects ~10k to GND for normal operation. Without it, charging may not start or may be unreliable. Place near TP4056 TEMP pin. Design includes unpopulated NTC footprint for upgrade path. Auto-add with TP4056.

pins.notes: Non-polarised passive. Either orientation.

res_10k_ntc_disable.substitution_notes: Standard value — any R equivalent acceptable. Prefer JLCPCB basic stock for lowest assembly cost.

charge_led_green.ipc610_notes: 0402 green LED. TP4056 STDBY pin drives this (active low = charge complete). 1k series resistor (share res_1k_0402). Place next to red charge LED. Full status: red=charging, green=full, both off=no USB power or fault. Auto-add with TP4056 LiPo charger.

pins.notes: Polarised LED. Cathode marked on package.

ptc_fuse_2a.ipc610_notes: 1812 PTC resettable fuse. 2A hold, 4A trip. Place in series on barrel jack positive input AFTER Schottky reverse-polarity diode, BEFORE regulator. Protects against wiring faults and short circuits on DC input. 16V rated — handles 12V input with margin. Self-resets after fault clears. Auto-add with barrel jack power.
safety_warnings: Fuse must be rated for maximum expected input current
Do not bypass fuse

pins.notes: Non-polarised passive. Either orientation.

fuse_holder_5x20.ipc610_notes: PCB-mount fuse holder for standard 5x20mm glass/ceramic fuse. Place in series on MAINS LIVE input BEFORE HLK-PM01 module. Use 250mA slow-blow fuse for HLK-PM01 3W (3W / 240V = 12.5mA nominal, but inrush is much higher). SAFETY CRITICAL: mains-rated fuse holder. Maintain 8mm creepage to low-voltage traces. Place at board edge for fuse access. Auto-add with mains AC-DC power.
safety_warnings: MAINS VOLTAGE — risk of electric shock and fire
Must use appropriately rated fuse (250mA slow-blow for HLK-PM01)
Maintain 8mm minimum creepage to low-voltage circuits
Board must be enclosed — no exposed mains connections
Installation by qualified electrician only

pins.notes: Fuse in series with MAINS_LIVE. Protects against short circuit in HLK-PM01 or wiring fault. Rating: T500mA 250V (fast-blow).

cap_10uf_vbus.ipc610_notes: 0805 10uF X5R MLCC. USB VBUS decoupling — place directly on VBUS after PTC fuse. USB 2.0 spec limits VBUS capacitance to 10µF max to prevent inrush tripping the host port. Do NOT use larger electrolytics on raw VBUS. Larger bulk caps (47µF+) go AFTER the regulator/charger IC, not on VBUS itself. Auto-add with USB power.
safety_warnings: Do not exceed 10µF directly on USB VBUS — violates USB spec and may trip host overcurrent protection

pins.notes: Non-polarised passive. Either orientation.

cap_10uf_vbus.substitution_notes: Standard value — any C equivalent acceptable. Prefer JLCPCB basic stock for lowest assembly cost.

lsm6ds3.ipc610_notes: LGA-14. Smaller and lower power than MPU-6050. Accel ±16g, Gyro ±2000dps. Machine learning core for activity detection. I2C default, SPI optional.

pins.notes: SDO selects I2C address. Lower power than MPU-6050 (0.9mA vs 3.9mA).

sh1106_oled.ipc610_notes: 1.3 inch OLED module. I2C interface. Larger than SSD1306 (0.96in). Same pinout and similar driver — library compatible with minor changes. Good for readability at distance.

pins.notes: Same pinout as SSD1306 module. 1.3 inch vs 0.96 inch.

st7789_tft.ipc610_notes: SPI TFT module. IPS panel — better viewing angles than ILI9341 TN panel. Smaller form factor. 240x280 resolution. SPI interface, same pin pattern as ILI9341.

pins.notes: Write-only SPI (no MISO). Same interface as ILI9341. IPS panel.

eeprom_25lc256.ipc610_notes: SPI EEPROM. Use when I2C bus is full or SPI preferred. Same capacity as AT24C256 (32KB). Faster than I2C version (10MHz SPI vs 400kHz I2C).

control.name: WP
control.note: Write protect — HIGH for normal write

pins.notes: SPI EEPROM. Faster than I2C AT24C256 but uses SPI bus.

sgp30.ipc610_notes: MOX gas sensor. Outputs TVOC and eCO2 directly — no raw resistance calculation needed (unlike BME680). Smaller and simpler than BME680 but lacks temperature/humidity/pressure. Use alongside a separate temp/humidity sensor.

pins.notes: Fixed I2C 0x58. Needs 15s warm-up. Baseline calibration recommended every 1 hour.

dmg2305ux.ipc610_notes: P-channel MOSFET for highside switching. Vgs(th) -0.9V — turns on with 3.3V logic. Rds(on) 52mΩ at Vgs=-4.5V. Lower Rds(on) than AO3401A. Good for power gating GPS/camera modules.

pins.notes: P-channel highside switch. Gate LOW = ON, Gate HIGH = OFF. Source to supply, drain to load.

tca9548a.description: I2C 8-channel multiplexer. Allows up to 8 separate I2C buses from a single master bus, resolving address conflicts and enabling multiple identical-address devices.

pins.notes: Each downstream channel needs its own 4.7kΩ pull-ups. RESET is active-low, tie to VCC via 10kΩ if unused.

tca9548a.auto_add_note: Auto-suggested when I2C address conflict detected between two selected components.

txb0104.description: 4-bit bidirectional voltage-level translator. Auto-direction sensing, no direction pin needed. Suitable for I2C, SPI MISO, GPIO. NOT suitable for SPI SCK/MOSI (push-pull driven signals >10mA).

gpio.name: OE
gpio.note: Output enable, active high. Tie to VCCA to enable.

pins.notes: Auto-direction sensing. Do NOT use for strong push-pull outputs like SPI SCK/MOSI — use 74AHCT125 instead. Good for I2C (with external pull-ups on both sides) and open-drain signals.

txb0104.auto_add_note: Suggested for bidirectional I2C level shifting between 3.3V and 5V buses.

txb0108.description: 8-bit bidirectional voltage-level translator. Same auto-direction as TXB0104 but with 8 channels. Ideal for parallel buses and 8-bit GPIO expansion.

gpio.name: OE
gpio.note: Output enable, active high. Tie to VCCA.

pins.notes: Same limitations as TXB0104 — auto-direction, not for strong push-pull signals.

ap2112k_3v3.description: 600mA low-dropout regulator, 3.3V fixed output. Lower dropout (250mV) and lower quiescent current (55µA) than AMS1117. Good for battery-powered designs.

gpio.name: EN
gpio.note: Enable, active high. Tie to VIN if always-on.

pins.notes: Needs 1µF ceramic on input AND output (min). Much better than AMS1117 for battery applications due to low Iq.

mp2359.description: 1.2A 24V step-down (buck) converter, adjustable output. High efficiency replacement for LDOs when input-output voltage difference is large. Use with external inductor and feedback resistors.

gpio.name: FB
gpio.note: Feedback — resistor divider sets output voltage

pins.notes: For 3.3V output: R_top=100kΩ, R_bot=49.9kΩ. For 5V output: R_top=100kΩ, R_bot=24.9kΩ. Inductor: 10µH, Schottky: SS14.

power_source.note: Output voltage set by feedback resistor divider. Default config is 3.3V.

mcp6002.description: Dual rail-to-rail I/O op-amp, 1MHz GBW. Works from 1.8V-6V, much better than LM358 for single-supply 3.3V designs. Use for sensor signal conditioning, active filters, buffer stages.

pins.notes: Rail-to-rail I/O. Unity-gain stable. For 3.3V single-supply, bias inputs at VDD/2 (1.65V) using resistor divider.

inductor_10uh.description: 10µH shielded power inductor for buck converters. 1.5A saturation current minimum.

res_49k9_0402.description: Feedback bottom resistor for MP2359 → 3.3V output. Use with 100kΩ top resistor.

res_24k9_0402.description: Feedback bottom resistor for MP2359 → 5V output. Use with 100kΩ top resistor.

cap_100nf_bst.description: Bootstrap capacitor for buck converter BST-SW.

mov_varistor.description: Metal Oxide Varistor for mains surge protection. Clamps transient voltage spikes from lightning, switching surges, and ESD on the mains line. Placed across Live and Neutral, after fuse.
mov_varistor.ipc610_notes: Through-hole radial. Ensure leads are flush on bottom. Maintain creepage distances.
mov_varistor.auto_add_note: Added with HLK-PM01 for mains surge protection. Place after fuse, across L-N.

pins.notes: Non-polarised. Clamps at ~470V peak. Absorbs up to 56J per surge. Will eventually degrade after repeated surges — fuse provides backup protection if MOV fails short.

bat54s.description: Dual series Schottky diode in SOT-23 for ADC input clamping. Clamps overvoltage to VDD+0.3V and undervoltage to GND-0.3V.
bat54s.auto_add_note: Add to ADC input pins connected to external connectors where input voltage may exceed MCU VDD.

power.name: A (Common Anode)
power.note: Connect to signal line (after series resistor)

pins.notes: Series connection: pin 1 is the common anode (signal input). K1 clamps high to VDD, K2 clamps low to GND. Use with 10kΩ series resistor between connector and this diode.

cap_470uf_vmot.description: 470µF electrolytic capacitor for motor driver VMOT rail. Absorbs back-EMF energy and provides inrush current. 25V rating for up to 12V motor supply.
cap_470uf_vmot.auto_add_note: Bulk cap for motor driver VMOT rail. Place within 10mm of driver VMOT pin.

pins.notes: POLARISED — observe polarity marking. 105°C rated for thermal reliability near motor drivers.

tvs_vmot_15v.description: Unidirectional TVS diode for 12V motor supply protection. Clamps transient spikes from motor back-EMF. 15V standoff, 24V clamping.
tvs_vmot_15v.auto_add_note: TVS for 12V VMOT rail. Place across VMOT-GND near motor driver.

pins.notes: POLARISED — band marks cathode (connect to VMOT). Clamps at 24V. For 24V motor supply, use tvs_vmot_28v instead.

tvs_vmot_28v.description: Unidirectional TVS diode for 24V motor supply protection. 28V standoff, 45V clamping.
tvs_vmot_28v.auto_add_note: TVS for 24V VMOT rail. Use instead of tvs_vmot_15v when motor supply is 24V.

pins.notes: POLARISED. For 24V VMOT only.

res_10k_gate_pulldown.description: Pull-down resistor for P-FET reverse polarity protection gate. Ensures FET stays off when VIN is not connected.
res_10k_gate_pulldown.auto_add_note: Gate pull-down for P-FET reverse polarity protection on VIN input.

cap_10pf_0402.description: 10pF C0G/NP0 load capacitor for 32.768kHz crystal (STM32 LSE). C0G dielectric is essential — X7R/X5R ceramics have voltage-dependent capacitance that detunes the oscillator.
cap_10pf_0402.auto_add_note: Load caps for 32.768kHz crystal. Use C0G dielectric only — X7R is NOT acceptable for crystal load caps.
